com.pump.graphics

Class GraphicsWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Graphics
      • java.awt.Graphics2D
        • com.pump.graphics.AbstractGraphics2D
          • com.pump.graphics.GraphicsWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GraphicInstruction, java.io.Serializable, javax.swing.tree.MutableTreeNode, javax.swing.tree.TreeNode

    public class GraphicsWriter
extends AbstractGraphics2D
implements GraphicInstruction, java.io.Serializable, javax.swing.tree.MutableTreeNode
    This object provides a simple way to model/export layered vector graphics.

    As you render objects to this writer, several GraphicInstruction objects are collected in a stack. An exception is thrown if you attempt to use any composite that is not a AlphaComposite.SRC_OVER, because this assumes each element is rendered "on top of" all existing elements.

    The concept here is that simple vector art can be stored and translated. This object (and all instructions) should be fully serializable. Also you can pass this Graphics2D to any existing paint() method and then sift through the resulting instructions to export the data to another format. (For example, this model was originally designed to help export graphics to PPTX files.)

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • DEBUGGING

        public static boolean DEBUGGING

        protected static final java.util.Enumeration<?> EMPTY_ENUMERATION

    • Constructor Detail

      • GraphicsWriter

        public GraphicsWriter(boolean createMakesNewGroup)
        Parameters:
        createMakesNewGroup - if this is true, then when Graphics2D.create() is called for this object, a new writer will be created that contains its own distinct list of instructions. If this is false, then the same instruction list is shared between this object and its clone.

        This can be used to imply the existence of groups in vector graphics.

      • GraphicsWriter

        public GraphicsWriter(boolean createMakesNewGroup,
                      int instructionLimit)
        Parameters:
        createMakesNewGroup - if this is true, then when Graphics2D.create() is called for this object, a new writer will be created that contains its own distinct list of instructions. If this is false, then the same instruction list is shared between this object and its clone.

        This can be used to imply the existence of groups in vector graphics.

        instructionLimit - the maximum number of instructions this writer will store.

      • getInstructions

        public GraphicInstruction[] getInstructions(boolean simplify)
        Returns a list of instructions to render to recreate this graphics.

        Depending on how this writer was constructed, this may contain other GraphicsWriter objects (suggesting nested groups).

        Parameters:
        simplify - this removes empty groups/instructions from the instructions.
        Returns:
        an array of instructions that recreate this graphics.

      • getSource

        public java.lang.String getSource()
        Description copied from interface: GraphicInstruction
        Returns a string for developers to recognize the source of this instruction. By default this returns a stack trace, but it may return "Unknown" if the GraphicsWriter debugging flag is false.
        Specified by:
        getSource in interface GraphicInstruction
